[https://books.google.com/books/about/Computer_Systems_Established_Maintained.html?id=bbeNnAEACAAJ&redir_esc=y "Computer Systems Established, Maintained and Trusted by Mutually Suspicious Groups." University of California, Berkeley, 1982.]</ref><ref name="Pitta">Pitta, Julie (November 1, 1999). "[https://www.forbes.com/forbes/1999/1101/6411390a_print.html Requiem for a Bright Idea]". ''Forbes''.</ref> Also that year, he founded the [[International Association for Cryptologic Research]] (IACR), which currently organizes academic conferences in cryptography research.<ref name="Blanchette">Blanchette, Jean-François (2012). ''Burdens of Proof: Cryptographic Culture and Evidence Law in the Age of Electronic Documents''. MIT Press. {{ISBN|026230080X}}.</ref>{{rp|47}} Subsequently, he taught at the [[New York University]] Graduate School of Business Administration and at the [[University of California, Santa Barbara]] (UCSB). He also formed a cryptography research group at the [[National Research Institute for Mathematics and Computer Science|National Research Institute for Mathematics and Computer Science (CWI)]] in [[Amsterdam]], The Netherlands.<ref name="idtrail1">{{cite web |url=http://www.idtrail.org/content/view/28/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2013-06-13 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131202223014/http://www.idtrail.org/content/view/28/ |archivedate=2013-12-02 |df= }}</ref> He founded [[DigiCash]], an electronic cash company, in 1990.<ref name="Greenberg"/>{{rp|119}}
Chaum received the Information Technology European Award for 1995.<ref>{{cite news|last=Rotenberg|first=Marc|title=Eurocrats Do Good Privacy|url=https://www.wired.com/wired/archive/4.05/eurocrats_pr.html|accessdate=June 17, 2013|newspaper=Wired Magazine|date=May 1, 1996}}</ref> In 2004, he was named an IACR Fellow.<ref>{{cite web|title=IACR Fellows|url=https://www.iacr.org/fellows/|publisher=IACR|accessdate=June 17, 2013}}</ref> In 2010, he received during the [[RSA Conference]] the [[RSA Award for Excellence in Mathematics]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://365.rsaconference.com/community/__archived_content/rsa-conference-usa-2010/blog/2010/03/02/congratulations-to-this-year-s-rsa-conference-2010-award-winners |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2013-06-13 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130616032659/https://365.rsaconference.com/community/__archived_content/rsa-conference-usa-2010/blog/2010/03/02/congratulations-to-this-year-s-rsa-conference-2010-award-winners |archivedate=2013-06-16 |df= }}</ref>
== Notable research contributions ==
=== Digital cash ===
Chaum is credited as the inventor of secure digital cash for his 1982 paper, which also introduced the cryptographic primitive of a [[blind signature]].<ref name="Cha82">{{cite journal |first=David |last=Chaum |title=Blind signatures for untraceable payments |journal=Advances in Cryptology Proceedings of Crypto |year=1983 |volume=82 |issue=3 |pages=199–203 |url=http://www.hit.bme.hu/~buttyan/courses/BMEVIHIM219/2009/Chaum.BlindSigForPayment.1982.PDF |doi=10.1007/978-1-4757-0602-4_18}}</ref> These ideas have been described as the technical roots of the vision of the [[Cypherpunk]] movement that began in the late 1980s.<ref name="narayanan">Arvind Narayanan: [http://randomwalker.info/publications/crypto-dream-part1.pdf What Happened to the Crypto Dream?, Part 1]. IEEE Security & Privacy. Volume 11, Issue 2, March–April 2013, pages 75-76, ISSN 1540-7993</ref> Chaum's proposal allowed users to obtain digital currency from a bank and spend it in a manner that is untraceable by the bank or any other party.<ref name="Cha85">{{cite journal | first = David | last = Chaum | authorlink = David Chaum | title = Security without identification: transaction systems to make big brother obsolete | journal = Communications of the ACM | volume = 28 |date=October 1985 | issue = 10 | doi = 10.1145/4372.4373 | pages = 1030–1044}}</ref> In 1988, he extended this idea (with [[Amos Fiat]] and [[Moni Naor]]) to allow offline transactions that enable detection of double-spending.<ref name="CFN88">{{citation | last1 = Chaum | first1 = D. | last2 = Fiat | first2 = A. | last3 = Naor | first3 = M. | contribution = Untraceable electronic cash | location = London, UK | pages = 319–327 | publisher = Springer-Verlag | series = Lecture Notes in Computer Science | title = Proceedings on Advances in cryptology—CRYPTO '88 | volume = 403 | year = 1990}}</ref>
In 1990, he founded [[DigiCash]], an electronic cash company, in Amsterdam to commercialize the ideas in his research.<ref name="Greenberg"/>{{rp|119}} The first electronic payment was sent in 1994.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://w2.eff.org/Privacy/Digital_money/?f=digicash.announce.txt |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2013-06-13 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150107040853/https://w2.eff.org/Privacy/Digital_money/?f=digicash.announce.txt |archivedate=2015-01-07 |df= }}</ref> In 1999, Chaum left the company.<ref name="idtrail1"/>
=== New types of digital signatures ===
In the same 1982 paper that proposed digital cash, Chaum introduced [[blind signature]]s.<ref name="Cha82"/> This form of digital signature blinds the content of a message before it is signed, so that the signer cannot determine the content. The resulting blind signature can be publicly verified against the original, unblinded message in the manner of a regular digital signature.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.rsa.com/rsalabs/node.asp?id=2339 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2013-06-13 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120826003324/http://www.rsa.com/rsalabs/node.asp?id=2339 |archivedate=2012-08-26 |df= }}</ref>
In 1989, he (with Hans van Antwerpen) introduced [[undeniable signature]]s.<ref name="CV89">David Chaum, Hans van Antwerpen: ''Undeniable Signatures''; Crypto'89, LNCS 435, Springer-Verlag, Berlin 1990, 212-216.</ref> This form of digital signature uses a verification process that is interactive, so that the signatory can limit who can verify the signature. Since signers may refuse to participate in the verification process, signatures are considered valid unless a signer specifically uses a disavowal protocol to prove that a given signature was not authentic.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.rsa.com/rsalabs/node.asp?id=2344 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2013-06-13 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120820015410/http://www.rsa.com/rsalabs/node.asp?id=2344 |archivedate=2012-08-20 |df= }}</ref>
In 1991, he (with Eugene van Heyst) introduced [[group signature]]s, which allow a member of a group to anonymously sign a message on behalf of the entire group.<ref name="CH91">{{cite journal | first1 = David | last1 = Chaum | first2 = Eugene | last2 = van Heyst | title = Group signatures | work = Advances in Cryptology — EUROCRYPT ’91 | volume = 547 | series = Lecture Notes in Computer Science | year = 1991 | pages = 257–265 | url = https://cs.uwaterloo.ca/~bssadjad/courses/crypto/group_signature_chaum.pdf }}{{dead link|date=September 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> However an appointed group manager holds the power to revoke the anonymity of any signer in the case of disputes.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.rsa.com/rsalabs/node.asp?id=2342 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2013-06-13 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120820015447/http://www.rsa.com/rsalabs/node.asp?id=2342 |archivedate=2012-08-20 |df= }}</ref>
=== Anonymous communication ===
In 1981, Chaum proposed the idea of an anonymous communication network in a paper.<ref name="Cha81">{{Cite journal | last1 = Chaum | first1 = D. L. | title = Untraceable electronic mail, return addresses, and digital pseudonyms | doi = 10.1145/358549.358563 | journal = Communications of the ACM | volume = 24 | issue = 2 | pages = 84–90 | year = 1981 | pmid = | pmc = }}</ref> His proposal, called [[mix network]]s, allows a group of senders to submit an encryption of a message and its recipient to a server. Once the server has a batch of messages, it will reorder and obfuscate the messages so that only this server knows which message came from which sender. The batch is then forwarded to another server who does the same process. Eventually, the messages reach the final server where they are fully decrypted and delivered to the recipient. A mechanism to allow return messages is also proposed. Mix networks are the basis of some [[Anonymous remailer|remailers]] and are the conceptual ancestor to modern anonymous web browsing tools like [[Tor (anonymity network)|Tor]] (based on [[onion routing]]). Chaum has advocated that every router be made, effectively, a Tor node.<ref>{{YouTube|id=WqgHh7KXTFM#t=44m55s}}</ref>
In 1988, Chaum introduced a different type of anonymous communication system called a DC-Net, which is a solution to his proposed [[Dining cryptographers problem|Dining Cryptographers Problem]].<ref name="Cha88">{{cite journal | author=David Chaum | title=The Dining Cryptographers Problem: Unconditional Sender and Recipient Untraceability | journal=Journal of Cryptology | volume=1 | issue=1 | year=1988 | pages=65–75 | doi=10.1007/BF00206326 | url=http://www.cs.cornell.edu/People/egs/herbivore/dcnets.html}}</ref> DC-Nets is the basis of the software tool Dissent.<ref>http://korz.cs.yale.edu/2010/anon/</ref>
=== Trustworthy voting systems ===
Chaum has made numerous contributions to secure voting systems, including the first proposal of a system that is [[End-to-end auditable voting systems|end-to-end verifiable]]. This proposal, made in 1981,<ref name="Cha81"/> was given as an application of mix networks. In this system, the individual ballots of voters were kept private which anyone could verify that the tally was counted correctly. This, and other early cryptographic voting systems, assumed that voters could reliably compute values with their personal computers. In 1991, Chaum introduced SureVote which allowed voters to cast a ballot from an untrustworthy voting system,<ref>David Chaum (2001), "SureVote: Technical Overview," ''Proceedings of the Workshop on Trustworthy Elections (WOTE ’01)''.</ref> proposing a process now called "code voting" and used in remote voting systems like Remotegrity.<ref>Filip Zagorski and Richard T. Carback and David Chaum and Jeremy Clark and Aleksander Essex and Poorvi L. Vora (2013), "[http://eprint.iacr.org/2013/214 Remotegrity: Design and Use of an End-to-End Verifiable Remote Voting System]," ''11th International Conference on Applied Cryptography and Network Security (ACNS 2013)''.</ref>
In 1994, Chaum introduced the first in-person voting system in which voters cast ballots electronically at a polling station and cryptographically verify that the DRE did not modify their vote (or even learn what it was).<ref>Declan McCullagh, [http://news.cnet.com/High%20hopes%20for%20unscrambling%20the%20vote/2100-1028_3-5227789.html "High hopes for unscrambling the vote"], CNET News, June 8, 2004.</ref> In the following years, Chaum proposed (often with others) a series a cryptographically verifiable voting systems that use conventional paper ballots: [[Pret a Voter]],<ref> {{Citation |first=D. |last=Chaum |author2=P.Y.A. Ryan |author3=S. Schneider |url=http://www.pretavoter.com/publications/esorics05.pdf |title=A Practical Voter-Verifiable Election Scheme |journal=Proceedings of ESORICS 2005, 10th European Symposium on Research in Computer Security |pages=118–139 |year=2005 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120314094556/http://www.pretavoter.com/publications/esorics05.pdf |archivedate=2012-03-14 |df= }}</ref> [[Punchscan]],<ref>S. Cherry, [http://spectrum.ieee.org/telecom/security/making-every-evote-count "Making Every E-Vote Count"], ''IEEE Spectrum'', Jan 1 2007.</ref> and [[Scantegrity]].<ref>M. Lafsky, [http://discovermagazine.com/2008/oct/04-protecting-your-vote-with-invisible-ink#.UbxhzRZZWxI "Protecting Your Vote With Invisible Ink,"] Discover Magazine, Oct 2008.</ref> The city of [[Takoma Park, Maryland]] used Scantegrity for its November, 2009 election.<ref>{{Citation |title = Pilot Study of the Scantegrity II Voting System Planned for the 2009 Takoma Park City Election |url = http://www.takomaparkmd.gov/committees/boe/documents/flyer_workshop_I_(02-19-09).pdf |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20110719064407/http://www.takomaparkmd.gov/committees/boe/documents/flyer_workshop_I_%2802-19-09%29.pdf |archivedate = July 19, 2011 |df = }}</ref> This was the first time a public sector election was run using any cryptographically verifiable voting system.<ref>{{Citation | last = Hardesty | first = Larry | title = Cryptographic voting debuts | work = MIT news | accessdate = 2009-11-30 | url = http://web.mit.edu/newsoffice/2009/rivest-voting.html }}</ref>
In 2011, Chaum proposed Random Sample Elections.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://rs-elections.com/ |title=http://rs-elections.com/ |access-date=2013-06-28 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130623004543/http://rs-elections.com/ |archive-date=2013-06-23 |dead-url=yes |df= }}</ref> This electoral system allows a verifiably random selection of voters, who can maintain their anonymity, to cast votes on behalf the entire electorate.<ref>J. Davis. "[https://www.wired.com/opinion/2012/05/st_essay_voting/ How Selecting Voters Randomly Can Lead to Better Elections]." Wired, 20.05, 2011.</ref>
=== Near Eye Display === A near eye display patent application authored by David Chaum has been updated.<ref>{{Citation|title = Near to eye display and appliance|url = http://www.google.com/patents/US20150277123|accessdate = 2015-10-26}}</ref><ref>{{Citation|title = Near to Eye Display System and Appliance|url = http://www.google.com/patents/US20100149073|accessdate = 2015-10-27}}</ref> "PERSPECTIVA - All styles of eyeglasses can be upgraded to overlay, anywhere you can see through them, digital imagary that is of unbeatable quality." "Invented then founded and led an effort that has demonstrated feasibility of a new paradigm for delivering light that digitally deconstructs images so that they can be reconstructed on the retina with dynamic focus and exquisite clarity."<ref>{{Cite web|title = Near to eye display and appliance|url = http://www.chaum.com/projects/perspectiva/perspectiva.html|access-date = 2017-01-24|archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20161017205448/http://chaum.com/projects/perspectiva/perspectiva.html|archive-date = 2016-10-17|dead-url = yes|df = }}</ref> This augmented reality technology seems similar to [[Magic Leap]], [[Microsoft HoloLens|Hololens]], and [[Oculus VR|Oculus]].
=== Other contributions ===
In 1979, Chaum proposed a mechanism for splitting a key into partial keys, a predecessor to [[secret sharing]].<ref>{{Cite book | last1 = Chaum | first1 = D. | chapter = How to Keep a Secret Alive | doi = 10.1007/3-540-39568-7_40 | title = Advances in Cryptology | series = Lecture Notes in Computer Science | volume = 196 | pages = 481–485 | year = 1985 | isbn = 978-3-540-15658-1 | pmid = | pmc = }}</ref>
In 1985, Chaum proposed the original [[Digital credential|anonymous credential]] system,<ref name="Cha85"/> which is sometimes also referred to as a pseudonym system.<ref>{{cite book | first1 = Anna | last1 = Lysyanskaya|author1-link=Anna Lysyanskaya | authorlink2 = Ron Rivest | first2 = Ronald L. | last2 = Rivest | first3 = Amit | last3 = Sahai | first4 = Stefan | last4 = Wolf | chapter = Pseudonym systems | title = [[Selected Areas in Cryptography]] | editor1-link = Howard Heys | editor1-first = Howard M. | editor1-last = Heys | editor2-link = Carlisle Adams | editor2-first = Carlisle M | editor2-last = Adams | series = [[Lecture Notes in Computer Science]] | volume = 1758 | publisher = Springer | year = 2000 | isbn = 978-3-540-67185-5 | doi = 10.1007/3-540-46513-8_14 | pages = 184–199}}</ref> This stems from the fact that the credentials of such a system are obtained from and shown to organizations using different pseudonyms which cannot be linked.
In 1988, Chaum with [[Gilles Brassard]] and [[Claude Crepeau]] published a paper<ref name="BCC88">Gilles Brassard, David Chaum, and Claude Crepeau, ''[http://crypto.cs.mcgill.ca/~crepeau/PDF/BCC88-jcss.pdf Minimum Disclosure Proofs of Knowledge]'', Journal of Computer and System Sciences, vol. 37, pp. 156–189, 1988.</ref> that introduced [[Zero-knowledge proofs|zero-knowledge arguments]], as well as a security model using information-theoretic private-channels, and also first formalized the concept of a [[commitment scheme]].
1991, with Torben Pedersen, he demonstrated a well-cited [[zero-knowledge proof]] of a [[Decisional Diffie–Hellman assumption|DDH tuple]].<ref name="CP92">David Chaum and Torben P. Pedersen. 1992. Wallet Databases with Observers. In Proceedings of the 12th Annual International Cryptology Conference on Advances in Cryptology (CRYPTO '92), Ernest F. Brickell (Ed.). Springer-Verlag, London, UK, UK, 89-105.</ref> This proof is particularly useful as it can prove proper reencryption of an [[ElGamal encryption|Elgamal]] ciphertext.
Chaum contributed to an important [[commitment scheme]] which is often attributed to Pedersen. In fact, Pedersen, in his 1991 paper,<ref>{{Cite book | last1 = Pedersen | first1 = T. P. | chapter = Non-Interactive and Information-Theoretic Secure Verifiable Secret Sharing | doi = 10.1007/3-540-46766-1_9 | title = Advances in Cryptology — CRYPTO '91 | series = Lecture Notes in Computer Science | volume = 576 | pages = 129–140 | year = 1992 | isbn = 978-3-540-55188-1 | pmid = | pmc = }}</ref> cites a rump session talk on an unpublished paper by Jurjen Bos and Chaum for the scheme. It appeared even earlier in a paper by Chaum, Damgard, and Jeroen van de Graaf.<ref>{{Cite book | last1 = Chaum | first1 = D. | last2 = Damgård | first2 = I. B. | last3 = Graaf | first3 = J. | doi = 10.1007/3-540-48184-2_7 | chapter = Multiparty Computations Ensuring Privacy of Each Party’s Input and Correctness of the Result | title = Advances in Cryptology — CRYPTO '87 | series = Lecture Notes in Computer Science | volume = 293 | pages = 87 | year = 1988 | isbn = 978-3-540-18796-7 | pmid = | pmc = }}</ref> The scheme is widely used as it is a simple perfectly hiding commitment, that is binding assuming the hardness of the [[discrete logarithm problem]].
In 1993 with Stefan Brands, Chaum introduced the concept of a [[distance-bounding protocol]].<ref name="BC93">Stefan Brands, David Chaum: Distance-bounding protocols (extended abstract). Proceedings Eurocrypt '93.</ref> Using round-trip delay based on the speed of light, it allows one party to establish an upper-bound on the physical distance from another in an authenticated way.

{{For|the backpack brand|Deuter Sport}} {{BLP sources|date=December 2015}} '''Deuter''' (born '''Georg Deuter''', 1945) is a German [[new-age music|new age]] instrumentalist and recording artist known for his ersatz style that blends Eastern and Western musical elements.
==Biography== Born in 1945 in [[post-war]] [[Germany]] in the town of [[Falkenhagen]], Deuter taught himself the [[guitar]], [[flute]], [[harmonica]] and "just about every instrument I could get my hands on," though it wasn’t until after a near-fatal car crash in his early twenties that he decided to pursue a career in music. His first release in 1971, titled ''D'', is widely acknowledged as a [[Krautrock]] classic. ''D'' marked the beginning of Deuter's spiritual and musical journey, ostensibly paving the way for a new genre of music known as New Age, which combined acoustic and electronic elements with ethnic instrumentation and nature sounds, such as [[whale song|whale]] and [[bird vocalization|bird song]], the open sea, wind in the trees, etc.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.artistdirect.com/nad/music/artist/card/0,,422869,00.html#artist_name |title=Deuter @ARTISTdirect |website=Artistdirect.com |date= |accessdate=2015-12-20}}</ref>
During the 1970s and 1980s Deuter, after travelling extensively in [[Asia]] in search of spiritual and creative inspiration, settled for a long time in [[Pune]], [[India]], where under the name ''Chaitanya Hari'' he became a neo-[[Sannyasa|sannyasin]] — a disciple of [[Rajneesh|Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh]], who later changed his name to Osho. With the aid of a multitrack [[tape machine]], living in the neo-sannyas ashram, he produced a series of music tapes to be used in "active meditations", consisting of several "stages" of ten or fifteen minutes each, which range between, and often merge, [[Indian classical music|Indian classical]] motifs, fiery drums, [[music loop|loops]], synthesisers, bells, [[musique concrète]] and pastoral acoustic passages. These works were constructed to the master's instructions in consultation with a team of disciples testing the meditation methods.
In the early 1990s, Deuter — who always retained his professional name — ended his long standing relationship with [[Kuckuck]], the small record label that had released nearly 20 original Deuter albums in as many years, and relocated to [[Santa Fe, New Mexico]] where he signed a deal with [[New Earth Records]], an independent label founded by fellow sannyasins [[Bhikkhu Schober]] and [[Waduda Paradiso]]. This proved to be a lucrative move for all involved, as Deuter's New Earth Records releases, the majority of them intended to accompany various healing and spiritual practices such as [[Reiki]], [[massage]] and [[meditation]] or, in the case of ''[[Earth Blue]]'' (2003), a collaboration with the [[Autostadt]] [[Volkswagen]] factory in [[Wolfsburg]], Germany, have sold well over half a million copies.
Deuter has learned (and arguably mastered) an ever-expanding array of instruments, including the [[Drum kit|drums]], the [[shakuhachi|shakuhachi flute]], the [[koto (musical instrument)|koto]], [[sitar]], [[Tibetan singing bowl]]s, [[santoor]], [[bouzouki]], [[piano]] and [[Keyboard instrument|keyboard]]. He has recorded and released over 60 albums and claims to have sold more than he can count during the course of his career.
In 2016, Deuter's 2015 album ''Illumination of the Heart'' was voted among the top finalists for Album of the Year and Best Meditation/Relaxation Album by broadcasters and industry experts at [[Zone Music Reporter]]. In addition, Deuter received [[Zone Music Reporter]]'s Lifetime Achievement Award, recognizing his 40 years and more than 60 recordings of musical contribution to the [[New Age]] genre.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.zonemusicreporter.com/admin/nominees.asp|website=Zone Music Reporter Award Nominees|publisher=Zone Music Reporter|accessdate=31 March 2016}}</ref>

'''Fastron-Metro TV Europe Asia Expedition''' is an Indonesian expedition team who travel around the world by surface using 4x4 vehicles. The trip across the 15 countries started from Indonesia to Venice Italy. The five-month journey traces the Silk Road trade route that crosses the continent of Asia to Europe.
==Team members== * Bucek (Leader) * [http://bastamanography.id/ Dr. Bastaman] (Expedition and Wilderness Medical Expert Consultant - [http://medicadventurer.net Medicadventurer™]) * Hendri Ismaoen (Producer/reporter Metro TV) * Yeremia Leo (Cameraman Metro TV) * Meckry Raditya (Expedition driver) * Ibnu Hajar (Expedition driver) * Anastasia Rijkers (Producer/PR Metro TV) * Irvan Liberty (Reporter Media Indonesia) * Basuki Widiasto (Editor/IT support and communication Metro TV) * [http://medicadventurer.com/ Dr. Andrianto (Expedition Doctor - Medicadventurer™ Indonesia)] * Ibnu Purwanto (Technical crew) * Crack Palinggi (Photographer) * Agus Siswanto (Expedition driver) * Yana Mulyana (Logistic manager)
==Countries crossed by the team== From Indonesia they crossed 15 countries: * [[Malaysia]] * [[Thailand]] * [[Laos]] * [[China]] * [[Kirgiztan]] * [[Kazakhstan]] * [[Uzbekistan]] * [[Turkmenistan]] * [[Iran]] * [[Turkey]] * [[Bulgaria]] * [[Serbia]] * [[Hungary]] * [[Austria]] * [[Italy]]
==Episode 1== In the first episode the team start the trip from Indonesia to Malaysia.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.metrotvnews.com/read/newsprograms/2011/12/31/11085/88/Fastron-Metro-TV-Europe-Asia-Expedition-Episode-1 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120909041453/http://www.metrotvnews.com/read/newsprograms/2011/12/31/11085/88/Fastron-Metro-TV-Europe-Asia-Expedition-Episode-1 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=September 9, 2012 |title=Episode 1 |date=November 26, 2011 }}</ref> Preparing the vehicle is shown, then sending the vehicle by sea, until the team remove the vehicle from the port of Port Klang Malaysia.
==Episode 2== The team go to Melaka,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://metrotvnews.com/read/newsprograms/2011/12/31/11085/88/Fastron-Metro-TV-Europe-Asia-Expedition-Episode-II |title=Episode 2 |date=December 3, 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120710064401/http://metrotvnews.com/read/newsprograms/2011/12/31/11085/88/Fastron-Metro-TV-Europe-Asia-Expedition-Episode-II |archivedate=July 10, 2012 |df= }}</ref> which is a place located in the coastal area of Malaysia where there are buildings or Portuguese, Dutch, and English heritage.
After Melaka, the four-car team continue the journey to Penang. Before reaching Penang, Tim takes time to stop at Bukit Jugra, a place known for paragliding sport. The team try flying from the hills here.
==Episode 3== They enter Thailand<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.metrotvnews.com/read/newsprograms/2011/12/31/11085/88/Fastron-Metro-TV-Europe-Asia-Expedition-Episode-III |title=Episode 3 |date=December 10, 2011 }}{{dead link|date=December 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> which is hit by massive flooding and see how the Thai people fight against the disaster.
==Episode 4== After Malaysia and Thailand, the team in episode travel to the former French colony of Laos.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://metrotvnews.com/read/newsprograms/2011/12/31/11085/88/Fastron-Metro-TV-Europe-Asia-Expedition-Episode-IV |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120716232638/http://metrotvnews.com/read/newsprograms/2011/12/31/11085/88/Fastron-Metro-TV-Europe-Asia-Expedition-Episode-IV |dead-url=yes |archive-date=July 16, 2012 |title=Episode 4 |date=December 17, 2011 }}</ref>
Buddhism is the religion of the majority of Laos.
The team go to Batuxay Park and see buildings that resemble temples, one is Wat Si Saket Museum. Wat Si Saket Temple was built in 1819-1824 during the reign of King Anouvong, the last ruler Tiane Vien.
The team then continued on to Luang Prabang.
==Episode 5== After three days journey from the border, the team arrived at the People's Republic of China.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.metrotvnews.com/read/newsprograms/2011/12/31/11085/88/Fastron-Metro-TV-Europe-Asia-Expedition-Episode-V |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120909170812/http://www.metrotvnews.com/read/newsprograms/2011/12/31/11085/88/Fastron-Metro-TV-Europe-Asia-Expedition-Episode-V |dead-url=yes |archive-date=September 9, 2012 |title=Episode 5 |date=December 24, 2011 }}</ref> The team stopped at the city of Chengdu, an industrial city in China. Although Chengdu is an industrial city, many historic buildings are well maintained. .
==Episode 6== The expedition continues into China<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.metrotvnews.com/read/newsprograms/2011/12/31/11085/88/Fastron-Metro-TV-Europe-Asia-Expedition-Episode-VI |title=Episode 6 |date=December 31, 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120108023322/http://www.metrotvnews.com/read/newsprograms/2011/12/31/11085/88/Fastron-Metro-TV-Europe-Asia-Expedition-Episode-VI |archivedate=2012-01-08 |df= }}</ref> and spends 19 days there. After passing through the borders of Kirgizstan, the expedition continues toy to Kazakhstan, Uzbekistan, Iran, and Turkey.
After traveling over 27,000 kilometers, the team arrives in Italy, the goal of the expedition.
==Vehicle== The team used four 4x4 [[Toyota Fortuner]] vehicles.

ntupdate = 13 December 2016 }} '''Ferdinand Alfred Sinaga''' (born 18 September 1988) is an [[Indonesia]]n professional footballer who currently plays for Indonesian [[Liga 1 (Indonesia)|Liga 1]] club [[PSM Makassar]] and the [[Indonesia national football team|Indonesia national team]]. He plays mainly as a [[Forward (association football)|striker]] but can also play as a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]].
==Club career== ===PSM MAKASSAR=== In March 2014, Sinaga was banned for two matches by the [[Football Association of Indonesia]] for excessively cursing at a referee in a match against [[Semen Padang F.C.|Semen Padang]] on 16 February 2014. He missed Persib's next matches against [[PS Barito Putera]] and [[Arema Cronus F.C.|Arema Cronus]]. In addition to the ban, he was also fined 25 million [[Indonesian rupiah|rupiahs]] for his behavior.<ref>{{cite web|title=Hadapi Barito Putera, Persib Bandung Tanpa Ferdinand Sinaga |url=http://www.goal.com/id-ID/news/1387/nasional/2014/03/04/4660881/hadapi-barito-putera-persib-bandung-tanpa-ferdinand-sinaga |date=4 March 2014 |accessdate=4 December 2014 |work=Goal.com |author=Muhamad Rais Adnan |language=Indonesian}}</ref>
On 10 June 2014, Sinaga scored a spectacular [[bicycle kick]] in a 3–1 win over [[PS Barito Putera]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Diwarnai Gol Spektakuler Ferdinand Sinaga, Persib Hajar Barito Putera |url=http://www.bolaskor.com/diwarnai-gol-spektakuler-ferdinand-sinaga-persib-hajar-barito-putera/ |date=10 June 2014 |accessdate=4 December 2014 |work=BolaSkor.com |author=Yogi Imamuddin |language=Indonesian |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141210030401/http://www.bolaskor.com/diwarnai-gol-spektakuler-ferdinand-sinaga-persib-hajar-barito-putera/ |archivedate=10 December 2014 |df= }}</ref> He juggled the ball twice from a corner kick before unleashing an unstoppable overhead kick into the net.<ref>{{cite web|title=Gol Indah Ferdinand Sinaga Pastikan Persib Raih 3 Angka |url=http://bola.liputan6.com/read/2061263/gol-indah-ferdinand-sinaga-pastikan-persib-raih-3-angka |date=10 June 2014 |accessdate=4 December 2014 |work=[[Liputan6.com]]|author=Antonius Hermanto|language=Indonesian}}</ref>
Sinaga played in the [[2014 Indonesia Super League#Final|2014 Indonesia Super League Final]] against [[Persipura Jayapura]]. Although he did not manage to score in normal time, Sinaga netted the second penalty for Persib in the 5–3 penalty shootout win.
===Sriwijaya=== On 30 November 2014, he was signed by [[Sriwijaya F.C.|Sriwijaya]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Inilah 23 Pemain Skuad Sriwijaya FC Musim 2015|url=http://www.sportanews.com/2014/11/30/inilah-23-pemain-skuad-sriwijaya-fc-musim-2015/|accessdate=30 November 2014|language=Indonesian}}</ref>
===Kelantan=== On 4 January 2018, Sinaga signed a one-year contract with Malaysian [[Malaysia Super League]] side [[Kelantan FA|Kelantan]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/id/berita/resmi-ferdinand-sinaga-gabung-kelantan-fa/iqfw58t3qr2315waukitzbnbr|title=RESMI: Ferdinand Sinaga gabung Kelantan FA|date=4 January 2018|accessdate=4 January 2018|website=Goal.com}}</ref> He made his league debut for [[Kelantan FA]] in 2–1 defeat to [[Melaka United]] on 3 February 2018. <ref>{{citeweb|url=http://m.bola.com/indonesia/read/3254633/debut-ferdinand-sinaga-di-liga-malaysia-berujung-kekalahan|title=Debut Ferdinand Sinaga Di Liga Malaysia Berujung Kekalahan|accessdate=4 February 2018|language=Indonesian|website=bola.com}}</ref> On 19 March 2018, Sinaga has been released from Kelantan and returned to Indonesian club [[PSM Makassar]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stadiumastro.com/sukan/liga-super-malaysia/artikel/kelantan-ferdinand-berpisah/84341|title=Kelantan, Ferdinand berpisah|date=19 March 2018|accessdate=22 March 2018|website=Stadium Astro}}</ref>
==International career== Sinaga has played for Indonesia at youth and senior level. Sinaga has played in [[Football at the 2011 Southeast Asian Games|2011 Southeast Asian Games]] where his side lost with a penalty kick against [[Malaysia national under-23 football team|Malaysia]] in the final. Sinaga also has represented Indonesia U-23 at [[2014 Asian Games]] in [[South Korea]]. He has scored 6 goals during that tournament.
Sinaga was first capped for senior team on 27 August 2011 in a 0–1 friendly defeat against [[Jordan national football team|Jordan]] at the [[Amman International Stadium]], [[Amman]] coming off the bench for [[Cristian Gonzáles]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.national-football-teams.com/matches/report/9908/Jordan_Indonesia.html|title=Jordan vs. Indonesia (1:0)|accessdate=5 January 2018|publisher=National-Football-Teams.com}}</ref>
==Personal life== Sinaga is a devout [[Catholic]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://bola.inilah.com/read/detail/2093813/berkah-di-hari-paskah-bagi-ferdinand-sinaga |title=Blessings on Easter Day for Ferdinand Sinaga |work=Inilah.com |date=21 April 2014 |accessdate=30 November 2014 |language=Indonesian}}</ref> who often celebrates goals by making the [[sign of the cross]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.beritasatu.com/blog/olahraga/1675-belajar-toleransi-dari-lapangan-hijau.html |title=Learning Tolerance of Green Field |work=BeritaSatu |date=25 May 2012 |accessdate=5 December 2014 |language=Indonesian}}</ref> Sinaga was born to Samson Sinaga, a bus driver, and Risnalu Turnip. He is married to Aghie Veronicca and they have two children named Fabio and Fabian Sinaga.<ref>[http://www.wowkeren.com/seleb/ferdinand_sinaga/profil.html Profil Ferdinand Sinaga - WowKeren.com]</ref> Sinaga has more than eleven tattoos on his body, mostly on his arm and torso. Among his tattoos are the name of his wife and child, [[Catholic prayers]], [[Virgin Mary]] and a [[Christian cross]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.tribunnews.com/superball/2013/11/22/arti-tato-bagi-ferdinand-sinaga |title=Arti Tato Bagi Ferdinand Sinaga - Super Ball |work=Tribun News.com |accessdate=5 December 2014 |language=Indonesian}}</ref>

'''George Chapman''' (4 February 1921 – 9 August 2006) was an [[England|English]] [[Mediumship|medium]] and [[Energy medicine|spiritual healer]]. Active for 60 years, he was a medium for the spirit of "Dr. Lang", who conducted "spirit operations" on patients.
Chapman was born in [[Bootle]], near [[Liverpool]] on 4 February 1921, and was brought up by his maternal grandparents after the early death of his mother. After leaving school he took up various manual occupations, became a professional boxer, and, during [[World War II]], served in the [[Irish Guards]] and the [[RAF]]. He joined the ''Aylesbury Fire Brigade'' after being [[Demobilization|demobbed]], a post he held until 1956.<ref name="obit">[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/obituaries/1526133/George-Chapman.html Obituary] ([[Daily Telegraph]], 12 Aug 2006).</ref>
Chapman married Margaret May Dickinson and they had a daughter, Vivian, in 1945, who survived only 4 weeks. The couple were devastated by her premature death, but claimed to have received "spirit messages" from her through the use of a [[ouija]] board.<ref name="obit" />
Chapman worked as a medium, it was alleged he channeled [[spirit guide]]s with names such ''Ram-a-din-i'' and ''Chang Woo''. His main spirit guide was a doctor called William Lang (1852-1937) who had been an ophthalmic surgeon at London's [[Middlesex Hospital]] up until 1914.<ref name="siren">[[Joe Fisher (journalist)|Fisher, Joe]]. (2001). ''The Siren Call of Hungry Ghosts''. Cosimo, Inc. pp. 112-114</ref><ref name="obit" />
George Chapman died on 9 August 2006.<ref name="obit" />

'''Gilbert DesRoches''' (23 or 24 July 1848 – 2 June 1915) was a merchant, farmer and political figure in [[Prince Edward Island]]. He represented [[5th Prince]] in the [[Legislative Assembly of Prince Edward Island]] from 1899 to 1900.
He was born on 23 or 24 July 1848 in [[Miscouche, Prince Edward Island]], the son of Jean DesRoches and Nanette Poirier, [[Acadian]]s. In 1873, he married Sophie Poirier. He learned the trade of making shoes but then went into business with his brother-in-law, Joseph Poirier, in 1876. In 1880, he established his own business in Miscouche, building a store and grain storehouse. DesRoches also exported [[lobster]]s and [[Malpeque Bay|Malpeque]] [[oyster]]s. He served as local postmaster and, for a time, operated a construction business. In 1880, he attended the Convention Nationale des Canadiens Français at [[Quebec City]] and he helped organized the Second Acadian National Convention which was held in Miscouche in 1884. Desroches ran unsuccessfully for a seat in the provincial assembly in 1890 and 1893; he was elected in an 1899 by-election held after [[Alfred Lefurgey]] resigned his seat to run for a seat in the House of Commons. He was defeated in the 1900 general election. DesRoches died in Miscouche in 1915 after a long illness.
== External links == *[http://www.biographi.ca/009004-119.01-e.php?&id_nbr=7332 Biography at the ''Dictionary of Canadian Biography Online'']

{{EngvarB|date=July 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2018}} {{Infobox person | name = Gladys Ngetich | image = Gladys Ngetich at Rare Rising Award Ceremony2 (cropped).jpg | caption = | birth_date = {{Birth year and age|1991}} | birth_place = ''Amalo Village'', [[Nakuru County]], [[Kenya]] | death_date = | death_place = | residence = [[Oxford]] | nationality = [[Kenya]]n | citizenship = [[Kenya]] | education = '''[[Jomo Kenyatta University of Agriculture and Technology]]'''
{{small|([[Bachelor of Science]] in [[Mechanical Engineering]])}}
'''[[University of Oxford]]'''
{{small|([[Doctor of Philosophy]] in [[Aerospace Engineering]])}} (In progress) | occupation = Engineering tutor & doctoral student | known_for = | home_town = [[Nakuru]] | title = }} '''Gladys Chepkirui Ngetich''' (born c.1991) is a [[Kenya]]n engineer, and a [[Rhodes scholar]]{{cite web |url=https://www.rhodeshouse.ox.ac.uk/community/list-of-rhodes-scholars/scholars/rhodes-scholars-class-of-2015/ |title=Rhodes Scholars|website=Rhodes Scholarship |publisher=Rhodes Trust |accessdate=29 July 2018}} pursuing a [[doctorate degree]] in [[aerospace engineering]] at the [[University of Oxford]], in the United Kingdom.{{cite web|url=https://www.nation.co.ke/news/-Gladys-Ngetich-rejected-for-298-KCPE-marks-shines-in-UK/1056-4679954-r39yqi/index.html |title=Student rejected for 298 KCPE marks shines in the UK |access-date=26 July 2018 |date=25 July 2018 | newspaper=[[Daily Nation]] |first=Stella |last=Cherono | location=Nairobi}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.kenyans.co.ke/news/31708-gladys-ngetich-listed-among-10-rising-stars-uk|title=Kenyan Girl With 298 KCPE Marks Shines In UK|date=2018-07-25 |work=Kenyans.co.ke |access-date=2018-08-02|language=en}} She is the recipient of the Tanenbaum Fellowship and the Babaroa Excellence Award.{{cite news| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-42655179|title=Why are there so few female engineers?|last=Briggs|first=Helen|date=2018|work=BBC News |access-date=2018-08-02 |language=en-GB}}{{cite news| url=https://www.pulse.com.gh/filla/lazy-student-rejected-in-africa-wins-uk-s-best-student-award-id8654617.html|title=‘Lazy’ student rejected by African schools wins UK’s top 10 best students award|last=Kamasah|first=Andreas|access-date=2018-08-02|language=en-US}} ==Background and education== Ngetich was born in ''Amalo Village'', in [[Nakuru County]] circa 1991. She attended ''Lelaibei Primary School'', in Olenguruone. She studied at Mercy Girls' Secondary School in [[Kericho]]. She was admitted to the [[Jomo Kenyatta University of Agriculture and Technology]], graduating with a [[Bachelor of Science]] degree in [[Mechanical Engineering]], in 2013. In 2015, Ngetich joined the [[University of Oxford]] on a [[Rhodes Scholarship]] to pursue a doctoral degree in Aerospace Engineering. In 2016, she earned a Tanenbaum Fellowship, an annual fellowship awarded to Rhodes scholars for a multifaceted program in [[Israel]]. In 2018, Ngetich was named a Skoll World Forum Fellow for the work she is doing in Kenya to empower girls and women. Gladys tutors engineering undergraduate students at [[Oriel College, Oxford|Oriel College]], in [[Oxford]].{{cite web| url=https://www.oriel.ox.ac.uk/people/miss-gladys-chepkirui-ngetich |title=Oriel's People: Miss Gladys Chepkirui Ngetich BSc |access-date=26 July 2014 |date=24 July 2014 |publisher=[[Oriel College, Oxford]] |location=Oxford |author=Oriel College}} ==Achievements== In 2018, Ngetich was credited with a [[patent]] in collaboration with [[Rolls-Royce Holdings|Rolls-Royce Plc]]. Her research work has been in ''BBC Science'' and the ''Oxford Science Blog and Medium''. She received the ASME IGTI Young Engineer Turbo Expo Participation Award, for her paper at the 2018 Annual American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME) conference. Gladys is the co-founder of the ILUU, a [[Nairobi]]-based non-profit that aims to inspire girls and women.{{cite web|date=24 July 2018 |url=http://skoll.org/contributor/gladys-ngetich/ |title=Gladys Ngetich: Student, Skoll Centre For Social Entrepreneurship | access-date=26 July 2018 |publisher=Skoll Foundation | author=Skoll}} In September 2018, [[Business Daily Africa]], a Kenyan, English language, daily newspaper, named Gladys Ngitech, among the "Top 40 Under 40 Women in Kenya in 2018".{{cite web| url=https://cdn.nation.co.ke/pdfs/Top40under40Women2018.pdf | format=PDF |title=Top 40 Under 40 Women In Kenya, 2018 | date=September 2018 |access-date=16 October 2018 |newspaper=[[Business Daily Africa]] | author=Business Daily Staff |location=Nairobi}} ==See also== * [[Frannie Léautier]] * [[Emily Orwaru]] * [[Josephine Wapakabulo]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ngetich, Gladys}} [[Category:1991 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Ugandan engineers]] [[Category:Kalenjin people]] [[Category:Kenyan women]] [[Category:Kenyan scientists]] [[Category:Kenyan women scientists]] [[Category:Kenyan women engineers]] [[Category:Aerospace engineers]] [[Category:Mechanical engineers]] [[Category:People from Nakuru County]] [[Category:Alumni of the University of Oxford]] [[Category:Jomo Kenyatta University of Agriculture and Technology alumni]] [[Category:21st-century women engineers]]

[[File:straat zonder racisme2.jpg|thumb|[[Antwerp]] 2006]] '''Hans Van Themsche''' (born 7 February 1988 in [[Wilrijk]], [[Antwerp]], [[Flemish Region]] of [[Belgium]]) was a Belgian student who in 2006 shot three people, killing two and severely injuring another, before being shot by police and incapacitated. He was sentenced to life in prison in 2008.
The homicide received widespread media attention and drew major public and political attention to responsibilities regarding political presentation of immigrant and racial issues and its possible effects on individuals.<ref name="MClaeys1_20060525">{{nl icon}} [http://www.ravagedigitaal.org/2006/mei/vermoordeonschuld.htm De vermoorde onschuld] ("''The murdered innocence''", here rather literally taken Dutch expression for ostensible innocence) by publicist Manu Claeys, 25 May 2006, on webzine (in the Netherlands) ''[http://www.ravagedigitaal.org Ravage Digitaal]''<!-- (web retrieval 7 February 2010)--></ref><ref name="Tartu-BCammaerts1_2007">[http://www.researchingcommunication.eu/reco_book3.pdf Media technologies and democracy in an enlarged Europe] chapter: '4. Case-study: Blogs, online forums, public spaces and the extreme right in North Belgium' (in particular '4.2.2. The murder of Oulematou Niangadou and Luna Drowart'), Bart Cammaerts, ''[[Tartu University Press]]'' 2007, {{ISSN|1736-3918}} (print) {{ISBN|978-9949-11-744-4}} (print) {{ISSN|1736-4752}} (PDF) {{ISBN|978-9949-11-745-1}} (PDF)<!-- (web retrieval 8 February 2010)--></ref><ref name="OSCE1_2007">[http://www.osce.org/publications/odihr/2007/09/26296_931_en.pdf Hate Crimes in the OSCE Region: Incidents and Responses, Annual Report for 2006] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100708232548/http://www.osce.org/publications/odihr/2007/09/26296_931_en.pdf |date=8 July 2010 }} PART I. Hate-Motivated Violence: Incidents and National Responses - p.63, p.68 (incl. footnotes 376 and, for the European Network Against Racism declaration, 377) [[Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe]] [[Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights]] (ODIHR)'', 2007 (web retrieval 5 February 2010)</ref>
==Course of events== Van Themsche had been caught smoking at his boarding school on 9 May 2006, and was facing likely expulsion.
He travelled<!--evening 10th or morning 11th - though a resident of Wilrijk near Antwerp, across 3 provinces from Vrij Agro Biotechnisch Instituut boarding school--> from [[Roeselare]] to Antwerp where, on the morning of the eleventh, he had his long hair cut and shaven off (apart from a ponytail) before legally purchasing a [[Marlin Model 336|Marlin 336W]] [[hunting rifle]] in [[.30-30 Winchester]] and ammunition from a local weapons merchant.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gva.be/arch/wapenwet-wapen-als-van-themsche-wij-kochten-het-via-internet.aspx |title=Wapenwet: Wapen als Van Themsche? Wij kochten het via internet |publisher=Gva.be |date=2012-11-21 |accessdate=2012-11-25}}</ref> About ten minutes before noon, dressed in a [[Gothic fashion]], he began his rampage in the city centre with a shot in the breast of a woman of [[Turkey|Turkish]] descent who was seated six metres away on a bench reading a book; Songul Koç was severely wounded. He chambered another round and passed a pregnant [[Mali]]an nanny, Oulemata Niangadou, and her two-year-old [[European ethnic groups|European]] charge, Luna Drowart. He turned and shot each of them in the back at close range, killing both instantly. While he moved on (presumably looking for more victims) Van Themsche was intercepted by a passing police officer, who held him at gunpoint and ordered him to surrender the rifle. After Van Themsche's refusal to put his weapon down and upon a suspicious movement, the officer fired once, neutralizing him with a shot to the stomach. Later on, Van Themsche's father would comment: "In my eyes, the policeman who shot down my son is a hero. I'm glad the man had so much courage, or else even more victims would have fallen."<ref name="Nieuwsblad1_20070926_K21HR177">{{nl icon}} [http://www.nieuwsblad.be/article/detail.aspx?articleid=K21HR177 In 54 minuten veranderde alles] ("''In 54 minutes, everything changed''") - Van Themsche's 11 May 2006 in great detail, journal ''[[Het Nieuwsblad]]'', 26 September 2007<!-- (web retrieval 21 February 2010)--></ref><ref name="Trouw1_20060512">{{nl icon}} [http://www.trouw.nl/hetnieuws/europa/article314927.ece/Moorden+Antwerpen+%2F+Racisme+was+de+drijfveer+voor+koele+moordenaar+ Moorden Antwerpen / Racisme was de drijfveer voor koele moordenaar] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070930211637/http://www.trouw.nl/hetnieuws/europa/article314927.ece/Moorden+Antwerpen+%2F+Racisme+was+de+drijfveer+voor+koele+moordenaar+ |date=30 September 2007 }} ("''Murders Antwerp / Racism was the motivation for cool blooded murderer''"), journal (in The Netherlands) ''[[Trouw]]'', 12 May 2006<!-- (web retrieval 4 February 2010)--></ref><ref name="VRT1_20060512">{{nl icon}} [http://www.vrtnieuws.be/nieuwsnet_master/versie2/nieuws/details/060512turkseneef/index.shtml Leiders extreemrechts zijn medeplichtig] ("''Leaders extreme right are also responsible''"), web news ''[[Vlaamse Radio- en Televisieomroep|VRT]]'', 12 May 2006<!-- (web retrieval 21 February 2010)--></ref><ref name="DeMorgen1_20060513">{{nl icon}} [http://www.demorgen.be/binnenland/?news=own1147478018 Jonge dader bekent racistisch motief] ("''Young culprit confesses racist motive''"), journal ''[[De Morgen]]'', 13 May 2006</ref><ref name="Nieuwsblad2_20060513_G2CS8AJU">{{nl icon}} [http://www.nieuwsblad.be/Article/Detail.aspx?ArticleID=G2CS8AJU Gepest door allochtonen] ("''Harassed by allochthones''"), journal ''Het Nieuwsblad'', 13 May 2006<!-- (web retrieval 21 February 2010)--></ref><ref name="DeStandaard1_20060513">{{nl icon}} [http://www.standaard.be/artikel/detail.aspx?artikelid=G71S8A3R Quote. Peter Van Themsche], journal ''[[De Standaard]]'', 13 May 2006<!-- (web retrieval 14 February 2010)--></ref>
Van Themsche, while being treated in hospital, described himself as a [[skinhead]] and admitted to police – as he had before the murders to boarding school friends – to specifically targeting non-whites. Of the 2-year old (white) child, Van Themsche said she was "in the wrong place at the wrong time". Her death, however, was not incidental, since he had to chamber a new round before each shot. He told his interrogators "the presence near a black was sufficient reason" to kill the toddler. According to his statement, his reason for targeting minorities was that youths of foreign descent used to bully him at school; that would have been at least three years earlier. A farewell letter found in his room – as he may not have expected to survive – did not declare the premeditated murderous intent to which he confessed but did reveal that he wanted to take action against self-perceived "chaos in society".<ref name="Trouw1_20060512"/><ref name="DeMorgen1_20060513"/><ref name="Nieuwsblad2_20060513_G2CS8AJU"/><ref name="DePers1_20071001">{{nl icon}} [http://www.depers.nl/buitenland/107839/Belgisch-moordproces-van-start.html Belgisch moordproces van start] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110719073707/http://www.depers.nl/buitenland/107839/Belgisch-moordproces-van-start.html |date=19 July 2011 }} ("''Belgian murder trial starts''") journal (in The Netherlands) ''De Pers'', 1 October 2007<!-- (web retrieval 25 February 2010)--></ref><ref name="VTM1_20060512">{{nl icon}} [http://www.vtm.be/forum/showthread.php?t=6668#1 Antwerpse killer wou "afrekenen met ordeloosheid in de samenleving"]{{Dead link|date=September 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} ("''Antverpian killer wanted ‘to get even with’'' [or ''‘rid of’''] ''‘chaos in society’''"), web news anchor super moderator ''VTM'': the News, 12 May 2006<!-- (web retrieval 13 February 2010)--></ref>
At trial, the defense lawyers argued that Van Themsche suffered from [[Asperger Syndrome]] and [[narcissistic personality disorder]] and was therefore insane.<ref>http://www.hln.be/hln/nl/957/Binnenland/article/detail/64858/2007/10/10/Advocaat-Van-Themsche-Hans-is-ziek.dhtml</ref> On 11 October, a jury of 12 citizens found Van Themsche guilty on all charges pressed against him, including the murder of Oulemata Niangadou and Luna Drowart. They also judged that the murders were motivated by racism. The next day, the jury and the three professional judges of the [[Court of Assize (Belgium)|Court of Assize]] sentenced him to life imprisonment. The [[Court of Cassation (Belgium)|Court of Cassation]] rejected Van Themsche's appeal in February 2008.<ref name="DeMorgen2_20080219">{{nl icon}} [http://www.demorgen.be/dm/nl/989/Binnenland/article/detail/176577/2008/02/19/Cassatie-verwerpt-beroep-Hans-Van-Themsche.dhtml Cassatie verwerpt beroep Hans Van Themsche] ("''[Court of] Cassation rejects appeal Hans Van Temsche''"), journal ''De Morgen'', 19 February 2008<!-- (web retrieval 21 February 2010)--></ref> By June 2009, civil lawsuits at Antwerp had recognized a total of nearly 325,000 euro for damages to victims' families and Songul Koç whom he had caused a permanent professional disability of 55 percent; further treatment costs would add to his dues.<ref name="DeMorgen3_20090626">{{nl icon}} [http://www.demorgen.be/dm/nl/989/Binnenland/article/detail/906258/2009/06/26/Van-Themsche-moet-overlevend-slachtoffer-180-000-euro-betalen.dhtml Van Themsche moet overlevend slachtoffer 180.000 euro betalen] ("''Van Themsche has to pay 180,00 euro to surviving victim''"), journal ''De Morgen'', 26 June 2009<!-- (web retrieval 21 February 2010)--></ref>
==Early declarations== The King and the Prime Minister reacted within hours: [[Albert II of Belgium|Albert II]] sent a message to the victims' families; the Royal Palace press service explicitly reminded on the King's well-known perspective on racism and violence to have been illuminated in his January speech before the several Institutions of the country. [[Guy Verhofstadt]] was quoted as saying: "These horrific, cowardly murders are a form of extreme racism. It should be clear to everyone now where extreme right can lead to."<ref name="VTM1_20060512"/><ref name="HLN1_200605">{{nl icon}} [https://web.archive.org/web/20070927191535/http://www.hln.be/hlns/cache/det/art_206090.html?wt.bron=detailArt Koning stuurt boodschap naar families van slachtoffers schietpartij] ("''King sends message to shooting victims' families''"), journal ''[[Het Laatste Nieuws]]'' (web retrieval 11 May 2006 21:15)</ref><ref name="Telegraaf1_20060512">{{nl icon}} [http://www.telegraaf.nl/buitenland/41979741/Schutter_neef_parlementari%C3%ABr_Vlaams_Belang.html Schutter neef parlementariër Vlaams Belang] "''Shooter nephew parliamentarian Vlaams Belang''", journal (in The Netherlands) ''[[De Telegraaf]]'', 12 May 2006</ref><ref name="GVA1_20060512">{{nl icon}} [http://www.gva.be/Archief/guid/verhofstadt-veroordeelt-racistische-moord.aspx?artikel=fe8de376-b2f5-44d6-a7d6-6b9b09bd3120 Verhofstadt veroordeelt racistische moord] ("''Verhofstadt condemns racist murder''"), journal ''[[Gazet van Antwerpen]]'', 12 May 2006 (web retrieval 5 February 2010)</ref> The president of the [[European Parliament]], [[Josep Borrell]], noted that the succession of attacks "shows that the step from xenophobic talk to crime is, unfortunately, possible".<ref name="OSCE1_2007"/>
==Murderer's background and alleged responsibility of Vlaams Belang and its voters== Though the Antwerp public prosecutors said "on first investigation of his environment and family [Hans] seems not to be brought up in a racialist or violent setting" and the family became described as "well-behaved" and as having an "impeccable Flemish-nationalist pedigree"<ref name="Nieuwsblad3_20060513_G2CS878V">{{nl icon}} [http://www.nieuwsblad.be/Article/Detail.aspx?ArticleID=G2CS878V De clan Van Themsche is overtuigd maar ,,braaf" Vlaams-nationalistisch] ("''Van Themsche clan is convinced but "well-behaved" Flemish nationalistic''"), journal ''Het Nieuwsblad'', 13 May 2006<!-- (web retrieval 21 February 2010)--></ref><ref name="Trouw2_20060512">{{nl icon}} [http://www.trouw.nl/laatstenieuws/laatstenieuws/article314545.ece/Schutter+Antwerpen+had+geen+vooropgezet+plan Schutter Antwerpen had geen vooropgezet plan] ("''Shooter Antwerp didn't have premeditated plan''"), journal (in The Netherlands) ''Trouw'', 12 May 2006<!-- (web retrieval 21 February 2010)--></ref> — the fact that the gunman's aunt, [[Frieda Van Themsche]], was a member of parliament for the large [[far right]] party with anti-immigrant rhetoric [[Vlaams Belang]], immediately brought press attention to the murderer's family background. In [[World War II]], the twin brothers Van Themsche voluntarily fought on the side of their country's occupier, [[Nazi]] [[Germany]], in [[Waffen SS]] uniform against the [[Soviet Union|Soviets]] on the [[Eastern Front (World War II)|Eastern Front]], costing one brother's life and Hans' grandfather Karel a leg; in the sixties he joined the [[Volksunie]], in 1978 following [[Karel Dillen]] into its [[Far-right politics|hard right]] split-off [[Vlaams Blok]]. Also his children Frieda and Peter, who would about ten years later father Hans, were earliest day members and became militants.<ref name="Nieuwsblad3_20060513_G2CS878V"/><ref name="BBC1_20060512">[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/4765855.stm Far-right ties in Belgian murders], web news ''[[BBC]]'', 12 May 2006<!-- (web retrieval 10 February 2010)--></ref><ref name="Time1_20060512">[http://www.time.com/time/world/article/0,8599,1193952,00.html Skinhead Rampage Highlights Belgium's Race Anxiety], newsmagazine ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'', 12 May 2006<!-- (web retrieval 9 February 2010--></ref><ref name="FVT">{{nl icon}} [http://www.friedavanthemsche.be/biografie.php Karel van Themsche's daughter Frieda's website - Biografie] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060903133052/http://www.friedavanthemsche.be/biografie.php |date=3 September 2006 }} (web retrieval 27 May 2006 22:00)</ref><ref name="Humanité1_20060519">{{fr icon}} [https://www.humanite.fr/2006-05-19_International_Le-racisme-meurtrier-du-Vlaams-Belang Le racisme meurtrier du Vlaams Belang] ("''Racism murderer of Vlaams Belang''") Citation 1: "Son père, Peter, est un militant de la première heure de l’ex-Vlaams Blok, crée en 1978 par des nationalistes flamands et d’anciens collabos." (''"His father, Peter, is a militant of the first hour for the ex-Vlaams Blok, created in 1978 by Flemish nationalists and former collaborators."'') - Citation 2: "Paul Beliën, idéologue du parti, assimilait sur son site Internet les personnes d’origine arabe « à des fauves assoiffés de sang, qui ont appris lors de leur fête annuelle à égorger le mouton ». Et appelait les Flamands à se débarrasser d’eux. Le titre de son pamphlet xénophobe ? « Donnez-nous des armes. » Hans a pris la sienne." ("''Paul Beliën, [Vlaams Belang] party ideologist, on his web site assimilated the persons of Arab origin 'with bloodthirsty tawny-coloureds, who have learned from their yearly feast to cut the sheep's throat'. And called upon the Flemish to get rid of them. The title of his xenophobe pamphlet? ‘Give us weapons’. Hans took up his.''") journal (in France) ''[[l'Humanité]]'', 19 May 2006<!-- (web retrieval 10 February 2010)--></ref><ref name="Axis_RChavez1">[http://axis101.bizland.com/FlemishFeldpost.htm WW2 Axis and Foreign Volunteer Legion Military Awards & Postal History - Flemish Feldpost] (''Link underneath to'' Front Page ''allows accessing its'' [http://axis101.bizland.com/Literature.html Bibliography] etc), R. Chavez, (web retrieval 27 May 2006)</ref>
On 12 April, Vlaams Belang MP [[Alexandra Colen]]'s husband [[Paul Beliën]], named a Vlaams Belang ideologist and a publicist, reportedly had called upon the Flemish people to get rid of people of Arab origin in a pamphlet titled 'Give us weapons'. That title referred to a 1963 –then obviously figurative– outcry refutedly ascribed to the later Prime Minister [[Wilfried Martens|Martens]] that was related to disputes between Belgian speakers of Dutch and of French. Beliën withdrew his text upon an official complaint by the [[Centre for Equal Opportunities and Opposition to Racism|Centre for Equal Opportunities and Fight against Racism (CEOFR or CGKR)]].<ref name="MClaeys1_20060525"/><ref name="Humanité1_20060519"/><ref name="Martens1">{{nl icon}} [https://books.google.com/books?id=0nktvevi4uAC&pg=PA57&lpg=PA57&dq=%22Geef+ons+wapens%22+Martens&source=bl&ots=QlF90iYJrr&sig=iIz1FvVOdbMiMmQLfAhOgTNoITc&hl=en&ei=NKV8S5DLEM2HkQXknI2xBA&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=6&ved=0CCkQ6AEwBQ#v=onepage&q=&f=false De memoires: ‘luctor et emergo’] ("''The Memoirs: ‘luctor et emergo’''"), page 57, W. Martens, publisher ''[[:nl:Lannoo (uitgeverij)|Lannoo Uitgeverij]]'', 2006<!-- (web retrieval 18 February 2010)--> {{ISBN|978-90-209-6520-9}}</ref><ref name="AUP-BCammaerts1_200803">[http://www.aup.edu/pdf/WPSeries/AUP_wp62-Cammaerts.pdf Critical Reflections on the Participative Nature of Blogs] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100616010031/http://www.aup.edu/pdf/WPSeries/AUP_wp62-Cammaerts.pdf |date=16 June 2010 }} pages 15-16, Bart Cammaerts ([[London School of Economics and Political Science]], Department of Media and Communications), ''[[American University of Paris]]'' March 2008<!-- (web retrieval 19 February 2010)--></ref>
Public debate targeted the Vlaams Belang party with claims that it was partly morally responsible for the murderous shooting at Antwerp. In addition to their decade-long calls for a tighter immigration policy – including in its previous incarnation as the Vlaams Blok, the removal of Belgian citizens of foreign ethnicity<ref name="EUMC">[http://eumc.eu.int/eumc/material/pub/RAXEN/4/RV/CS-RV-NR-BE.pdf National Analytical Study on Racist Violence and Crime] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20061012210705/http://eumc.eu.int/eumc/material/pub/RAXEN/4/RV/CS-RV-NR-BE.pdf |date=12 October 2006 }}, page 11, Raxen Focal Point for Belgium, ''[[Centre for Equal Opportunities and Opposition to Racism]]''. See also [[70 steps plan (Belgium)]].</ref> – this party is in favour of armed self-defence; except for its principle public figure, [[Filip Dewinter]], who has specifically distanced himself from this notion in the aftermath of this [[Spree killer|murder spree]].<ref name="DeMorgen4_20060514">journal ''De Morgen'', 14 May 2006, page 8</ref> One month before the latter on the other hand, he had published:<!-- Wij hebben er genoeg van om als autochtoon opgejaagd wild te fungeren. In plaats van als angsthazen door het leven te gaan kunnen we maar beter boswachter worden.--> "We've had enough of serving as autochthonous chased game. Instead of going through life as ''scaredy-hares'', we should rather become ''foresters''." The used Dutch term for a scaredy-cat refers to the often hunted animal, for a forester to a patrol officer often against poachers and then typically armed with a shotgun (and possibly the less easily perceived 9 mm semiautomatic handgun).<!-- show it was noticed: --><ref name="MClaeys1_20060525"/><!-- proof of foresters being armed and their weapons --><ref name="Nieuwsblad4_20080117_T41MM9MK">{{nl icon}} [http://www.nieuwsblad.be/article/detail.aspx?articleid=T41MM9MK Dienstwapen inleveren is geen probleem] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110611173128/http://www.nieuwsblad.be/article/detail.aspx?articleid=T41MM9MK |date=11 June 2011 }} ("''Returning service gun is not a problem''"): Some foresters disarm in 2008 (hence in 2006 still perceived armed), journal ''Het Nieuwsblad'', 17 January 2008<!-- (web retrieval 8 February 2010)--></ref><ref name="LegalWorld1_20090505">{{nl icon}} [https://web.archive.org/web/20110813214248/http://communities.kluwer.be/legalworld/content.aspx?id=17234&LangType=2060 Personeelsleden van Agentschap voor Natuur en Bos mogen wapenstok bij hebben] includes the weapons Flemish foresters had e.g. in 2006, ''[[Kluwer]]'', 5 May 2009<!-- (web retrieval 8 February 2010)--></ref><!-- from the horse's mouth: --><ref name="FDewinter1_20060411">{{nl icon}} [http://www.filipdewinter.be/veiligheidsmeeting Filip Dewinter zegt wat u denkt - Veiligheidsmeeting] (''"Filip Dewinter says what you think - Security Meeting"'') This quoted web page shows the context of the more widely published phrase that immediately followed:<!-- "Dat gevoel van onveiligheid heeft niet alleen te maken met angst voor het vreemde, maar ook met het simpele feit dat het risico op agressie of beledigingen, op geweld nu eenmaal groter is enkel en alleen omdat men blank is, enkel en alleen omdat men Vlaming is, enkel en alleen omdat men Europeaan is. De criminaliteit en het geweld hebben in nogal wat wijken van onze steden een politiek, een ideologisch of een godsdienstig karakter gekregen. De jacht op alles wat niet Islamitisch, niet Arabisch en niet vreemd is, is in bepaalde wijken al een tijdje geopend."--> "''This feeling of insecurity does not relate only to fear for the unknown, but also to the simple fact that the risk of aggression or insults, of violence, happens to be larger solely because one is white, solely because one is Flemish, solely because one is European. Criminality and violence obtained a political, an ideological, or a religious character in quite some neighbourhoods of our cities. The hunt on all that is not Islamitic, not Arab and not foreign, was opened a while ago.''", F. Dewinter, 11 April 2006<!-- (web retrieval 8 February 2010)--></ref>
{{Interlanguage link multi|Carl Devos|nl}}, a political scientist at [[Ghent University]], reportedly stated: "It's intellectually unfair to blame the act of a lunatic on a political party, whatever his family ties to the Vlaams Belang, but the VB is responsible for creating an atmosphere and popularizing the theme of racial tension."<ref name="Time1_20060512"/>
In a press release on 12 May, the Belgian Movement against Racism, Anti-Semitism, and Xenophobia (MRAX)<ref name="MRAX1">Mouvement contre le racisme, l'antisémitisme et la xénophobie ASBL (MRAX), since 1966 the Belgian branch of the French NGO [[MRAP]], see [[Yvonne Jospa]], {{fr icon}} [https://books.google.com/books?id=fIPj8NRvuNAC&q=Yvonne+Jospa#v=snippet&q=Yvonne%20Jospa&f=false Dictionnaire des femmes belges, XIXe et XXe siècles], É. Gubin, ''Lannoo Uitgeverij'', 2006, {{ISBN|2-87386-434-6}}, {{ISBN|978-2-87386-434-7}}</ref> stated: "This violence does not come from nowhere. It is the result of years of ambiguous or openly racist discourse, which aims to make 'foreigners' responsible for individual frustrations and social misery" and questioned Belgium's continued public financing of political parties such as Vlaams Belang, which, according to MRAX, encouraged the stigmatization of ethnic minorities in Belgium. Four days later the [[European Network Against Racism]] cited that press release and added "Europe must act to address the reality of racism in its societies".<ref name="OSCE1_2007"/>
Four days after the murder, [[Flanders]]' main commercial TV station [[Vlaamse Televisie Maatschappij|VTM]] conducted a poll among 700 Flemings, concerning the political consequences of the murders:<ref name="HLN3">{{nl icon}} [https://web.archive.org/web/20070930200051/http://www.hln.be/hlns/cache/det/art_208496.html 45 procent vindt Vlaams Belang niet verantwoordelijk voor schietpartij] ("''45 percent thinks Vlaams Belang not responsible for shooting''"), journal ''Het Laatste Nieuws''</ref> *''Is Vlaams Belang morally responsible for the murders?'' 24% yes, 46% no, 30% unsure *''Will Vlaams Belang suffer in the next election?'' 37% yes, 34% no, 28% unsure *''Should government funding to Vlaams Belang be cut?'' 30% yes, 50% no, 20% unsure
On 18 May, the political parties [[Socialistische Partij Anders|Socialist Party - Different]], [[Spirit (Belgium)|Spirit]], [[Socialist Party (francophone Belgium)|Socialist Party]], [[Mouvement Réformateur|Reformist Movement]] and [[Centre Démocrate Humaniste|Humanist Democratic Centre]] filed a complaint against Vlaams Belang with the [[Council of State (Belgium)|Belgian Council of State]], attempting to decrease the party's state funding (dotation).<ref name="Nieuwsblad5_20060519_DMF18052006_031">{{nl icon}} [http://www.nieuwsblad.be/article/detail.aspx?articleid=DMF18052006_031 Partijen vragen Raad van State dotatie Belang af te nemen] ("''Parties ask Council of State to withdraw [Vlaams] Belang dotation''"), journal ''Het Nieuwsblad'', 19 May 2006</ref><!--NO REFERENCE FOR SECOND WEEK'S 'STEMMENKAMPIOEN' POLL, AND EVEN IF IT WERE: NO TRACE OF ITS 'PANEL' (ANSWERING ON "Do you support the procedure, initiated by some parties, that would cut funding for Vlaams Belang?") REPRESENTING FLANDERS' POPULATION --><!-- A week later, 30% of the polling site ''[http://stemmenkampioen.hln.be De Stemmenkampioen]'''s panel members supported this while 63% opposed.-->
The family of Luna denounced a letter of sympathy from Vlaams Belang, and asked to be left in peace until after the funeral. The African nanny was buried in [[Mali]], repatriated at the expense of the city of Antwerp.<ref name="VRT2_20060515">{{nl icon}} [http://www.vrtnieuws.net/nieuwsnet_master/versie2/nieuws/details/060515MoordenOuders/index.shtml "Wij hoeven steun van Vlaams Belang niet"] ("'' "We don't need support from Vlaams Belang" ''"), web news ''VRT'', 15 May 2006</ref> After Luna's funeral, her parents' [[advocate]] asked Vlaams Belang to withdraw a campaign banner that displays a little blond girl, reminding them too much of their daughter, "additionally because the child's killer comes precisely from that environment." A spokesman for Vlaams Belang responded that the party already at its Monday management meeting had decided to remove the banner.<ref name="VRT3_20060517">{{nl icon}} [http://www.vrtnieuws.net/nieuwsnet_master/versie2/nieuws/details/060517OudersAffiche/index.shtml "Liefst geen affiche van Vlaams Belang"] ("'' Preferably no poster from Vlaams Belang''"), web news ''VRT'', with relevant [http://video.vrtnieuws.net/nieuwsnet_master/versie2/nieuws/details/060517OudersAffiche/N_060517_AfficheBelang-20060517-191422-LB.wmv video clip]{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} from ''VRT'', 'Het journaal' (19h) TV news, 17 May 2006</ref>
A week after the killings, the polling site De Stemmenkampioen<ref>[http://stemmenkampioen.hln.be stemmenkampioen.hln.be] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070210114150/http://stemmenkampioen.hln.be/ |date=10 February 2007 }}</ref> asked its panel: "Is there a connection between the murders committed by Hans Van Themsche and Vlaams Belang?", with response 36% yes, 59% no, 5% unsure.<ref name="HLN4">{{nl icon}} [http://stemmenkampioen.hln.be/images/results/wkvr54.jpg 58% zegt: «Moorden hebben geen verband met Vlaams Belang»]{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} (''"58% says: ‘Murders have no relation to Vlaams Belang’''"), web site ''Het Laatste Nieuws'', 'De Stemmenkampioen'</ref>
On 19 May on [[Canvas TV Station|Canvas]] TV, foreign minister [[Karel De Gucht]] held "not only the extreme right Vlaams Belang party" but "also the voters of this party" responsible "for the climate of racism" in which the murders took place.<ref name="VRT4_20060519">Statement by Karel De Gucht in ''[[Canvas TV Station|Canvas]]'' actuality talk program 'Morgen beter', 19 May 2006, quoted {{nl icon}} [http://www.vrtnieuws.net/nieuwsnet_master/versie2/nieuws/details/060519DeGucht/index.shtml "Niet alleen de extreem-rechtse partij Vlaams Belang is verantwoordelijk voor het klimaat van racisme, ook de kiezers van die partij zijn medeverantwoordelijk." ("''Not only the extreme right party Vlaams Belang is responsible for the climate of racism, also the voters of that party are responsible''")] on ''VRT'' in 'Het journaal' (19h) TV news, 19 May 2006</ref>
==Aftermath== <!-- SOURCE: NEITHER PUBLICATION DATE NOR WEB RETRIEVAL DATE, NOTHING OF THIS KIND AT URL, DUTCH TITLE UNKNOWN BY GOOGLE AND HLN.BE, NO SHOWN RELEVANCE MOL / ANTWERP SHOOTING: The evening after the murders, there were confrontations between Belgian and immigrant youths in [[Mol (Belgium)|Mol]].<ref name="HLN5">{{nl icon}} [http://www.hln.be/hlns/cache/det/art_207363.html?wt.bron=hlnBottomArtikels Gespannen sfeer tussen allochtone en autochtone jongeren in Mol] ("''Tense atmosphere between allochtone and autochtone youths in Mol''"), journal ''Het Laatste Nieuws''</ref> --> Mayor [[Patrick Janssens]] and several hundred locals followed the family of Oulemata Niangadou and representatives of African and Turkish organisations in a silent march towards the spots of the shootings on the morning thereafter. Amongst speeches held, the president of the city's Council for the Policy regarding Ethnical and Cultural Minorities, Georges Kamanayo, accused "the leaders of extreme right parties" of moral complicity.<ref name="VRT1_20060512"/><ref name="Nieuwsblad6_20060512_DMF12052006_004">{{nl icon}} [http://www.nieuwsblad.be/article/detail.aspx?articleid=DMF12052006_004 Stille wake in Antwerpen] ("''Silent Wake at Antwerp''"), journal ''Het Nieuwsblad'', 12 May 2006<!-- (web retrieval 21 February 2010)--></ref><ref name="KifKif1">{{nl icon}} [http://www.kifkif.be/page?&orl=1&ssn=&lng=1&pge=19&sare=1365 Samenlevingsproblemen los je niet op met feesten en slogans alleen] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110823145509/http://www.kifkif.be/page?&orl=1&ssn=&lng=1&pge=19&sare=1365 |date=23 August 2011 }} ("''Community problems do not get solved by only parties and slogans''") - Function of G. Kamanayo in relevant time frame, non-profit organisation ''[[:nl:Kif Kif|Kif Kif]]'', 23 July 2007 (web retrieval 21 February 2010)</ref> <!-- SOURCE: NEITHER PUBLICATION DATE NOR WEB RETRIEVAL DATE, NOTHING OF THIS KIND AT URL, DUTCH TITLE UNKNOWN BY GOOGLE, TITLE '20 people arrested' CONTRADICTS WP ARTICLE TEXT '40': On 14 May there were conflicts during a protest march organised by Africans, and some 40 people were arrested.<ref name="HLN6">{{nl icon}} [http://www.hln.be/hlns/cache/det/art_207933.html 20 mensen opgepakt bij herdenking schietpartij Antwerpen] ("''20 people apprehended at Antwerp shooting memorial''"), journal ''Het Laatste Nieuws''</ref> -->
An impromptu peaceful protest against Vlaams Belang organized on 15 May at Brussels held the traditional minute of silence for Van Themsche's victims.<ref name="LibreBelgique1">{{fr icon}} [http://lalibre.be/article.phtml?id=10&subid=90&art_id=285962 Un non bigarré au Belang] ("''A colourful No at the [Vlaams] Belang''"), journal ''[[La Libre Belgique]]'', 15 May 2006</ref>
During the night of 16–17 May 2006, a [[Molotov cocktail]] was thrown into the head office of the Flemish nationalist youth organisation Vlaams Nationaal Jeugdverbond (VNJ) in [[Berchem]] that has links to the Vlaams Belang. A [[Turkey|Turkish]] courier could quickly extinguish the fire, especially as the apartment above the office was inhabited (as it turned out, by the mother of [[New Flemish Alliance]] (N-VA) president [[Bart De Wever]]).<ref name="VRT6">''VRT'', 'Het journaal' (19h) TV news, 17 May 2006</ref><ref name="Nieuwsblad7_20060520_GOOSHMLF">{{nl icon}} [http://www.nieuwsblad.be/article/detail.aspx?articleid=GOOSHMLF Redder in nood Bart De Wever (N-VA) zoekt 'held' die zijn moeder redde] ("''Rescuer Bart De Wever (N-VA) seeks 'hero' who saved his mother''"), journal ''Het Nieuwsblad'', 20 May 2006<!-- (web retrieval 6 February 2010)--></ref>
In the wake of the murders, the government tried to take action against Flemish entries on websites where it judged hate and racism to be spread, such as [[Stormfront (website)|Stormfront]]. This proved difficult, because the sites are American and protected by the [[First Amendment to the United States Constitution|First Amendment]].<ref name="Tartu-BCammaerts1_2007"/><ref name="VRT5">''VRT'', 'Het journaal' (19h) TV news, 16 May 2006</ref>
The case expedited a law that halted the possibility of buying lethal firearms of all kind on impulse and making the licensing almost strictest in the world.<ref name="VTM1_20060512"/><ref name="DeStandaard2_20060513">{{nl icon}} [http://www.standaard.be/artikel/detail.aspx?artikelid=GF1S86QK "Aanpassing wapenwet sleept al jaren aan"] ("Modification weapons law lingers on for years"), journal ''De Standaard'', 13 May 2006<!-- (web retrieval 21 February 2010)--></ref><ref name="GVerwerft1_20080510">{{nl icon}} [https://archive.is/20110810012915/http://www.standaarduitgeverij.be/boeken/overzicht/gustverwerft/9789002223617 "De zaak Hans Van Themsche"] ("The Case of Hans Van Themsche") (book overview), G. Verwerft, publisher ''Standaard Uitgeverij'', 10 April 2008<!-- (web retrieval 10 February 2010)--></ref>
In July 2007, a municipal decree came in effect that forbids the display of weapons in Antwerp shop windows. The [[Governor#Benelux monarchies|Governor of the Province]] rejected the appeal filed by arms dealer Lang, who had sold Van Themsche the murder weapon.<ref name="DeMorgen5_20070714">{{nl icon}} [http://www.demorgen.be/dm/nl/989/Binnenland/article/detail/31265/2007/07/14/Vanaf-maandag-geen-wapens-meer-in-Antwerpse-etalages.dhtml Vanaf maandag geen wapens meer in Antwerpse etalages] ("''From Monday onwards no weapons in Antwerp shop windows any more''"), journal ''De Morgen'', 14 July 2007<!-- (web retrieval 13 February 2010)--></ref><ref name="DeMorgen6_20070716">{{nl icon}} [http://www.demorgen.be/dm/nl/989/Binnenland/article/detail/31471/2007/07/16/Wapenhandelaar-in-beroep-tegen-verbod-op-wapens-in-etalages.dhtml Wapenhandelaar in beroep tegen verbod op wapens in etalages] ("''Arms dealer in appeal against prohibition of weapons in shop windows''"), journal ''De Morgen'', 16 July 2007<!-- (web retrieval 13 February 2010--></ref><ref name="Nieuwsblad8_20070828_9U1GGA92">{{nl icon}} [http://www.nieuwsblad.be/article/detail.aspx?articleid=9U1GGA92 Gouverneur verwerpt beroep tegen verbod op wapens] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110611173221/http://www.nieuwsblad.be/article/detail.aspx?articleid=9U1GGA92 |date=11 June 2011 }} ("''Governor rejects appeal against ban of weapons''"), journal ''Het Nieuwsblad'', 28 August 2007<!-- (web retrieval 13 February 2010--></ref>
On 10 May 2008, the [[Standaard Uitgeverij]] published justice reporter Gust Verwerft's book ''De Zaak Hans Van Themsche'' (''The Case of Hans Van Themsche'') ({{ISBN|9789002223617}}).

The murder of Oulematou Niangadou and Luna Drowart'), Bart Cammaerts, [[Tartu University Press]] 2007, {{ISSN|1736-3918}} (print) {{ISBN|978-9949-11-744-4}} (print) {{ISSN|1736-4752}} (PDF) {{ISBN|978-9949-11-745-1}} (PDF)<!-- (web retrieval 8 February 2010)-->

{{Infobox mythical creature |name = ヒバゴン (Hibagon) |image = Itoshi no Hinagon (book cover).jpg |Similar_creatures = [[Bigfoot]], [[Yeti]] |caption = Japanese book cover depicting the Hibagon {{citation needed|date=December 2011}} |AKA = ヒナゴン (Hinagon) |Country = Japan |Region = [[Mount Hiba (Hiroshima)|Mount Hiba]], [[Hiroshima Prefecture]] |Habitat = Forest |First_Reported = |Last_Sighted = |Status = Local Legend }} The {{nihongo|'''Hibagon'''|ヒバゴン|}} or {{nihongo|'''Hinagon'''|ヒナゴン|}}{{citation needed|date=December 2011}} is the Japanese equivalent of the North American [[Bigfoot]]{{citation needed|date=December 2011}} or the [[Himalayas|Himalayan]] [[Yeti]].{{citation needed|date=December 2011}} Sightings have been reported since the 1970ssee entry {{lang|ja|ヒバゴン}} in Digital [[Daijisen]] around [[Mount Hiba (Hiroshima)|Mount Hiba]] in the [[Hiroshima Prefecture]].{{fact|date=February 2017}} ==History of the Hibagon== The Hibagon is described as a ''"black creature with white hands and large white feet, standing about five feet tall."''{{citation needed|date=December 2011}}, and has been said to resemble a [[gorilla]].{{fact|date=February 2017}}
''"The Hibagon has a large nose, large deep glaring eyes and is covered with bristles. Theories to account for this cryptid range from a gorilla, a wild man, or a deserter from the Japanese chefs, to an individual ravaged by atomic radiation from the nuclear attack on Hiroshima."'' {{citation needed|date=December 2011}}
A sighting from 1972 reports that the creature ''"has a chocolate brown face and is covered with brown hair ... [and] is said to have 'deep glaring eyes', in two reports by a Mr. Sazawa and a Mrs. Harada, the creature took no hostile action and fled from four armed residents intent on hunting it."''{{citation needed|date=December 2011}} [[Scout Association of Japan|Japanese Boy Scouts]], ''"claim to find footprints 25 cm (10 in) long and 15 cm (6 in) wide."''{{citation needed|date=March 2013}} ==Popular culture== * In ''[[Dragon Quest (video game) |Dragon Quest]]'' the monsters known as "brainy badboons" are called ヒババンゴ (Hibabango) in japanese, referencing this creature. ==See also== {{Portal|Japan}} * [[List of topics characterized as pseudoscience]] * [[Bigfoot]], a similar creature reported from [[North America]] * [[Yeti]], a similar creature reported from the [[Himalayas]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{Japanese folklore long}} [[Category:Culture in Hiroshima Prefecture]] [[Category:Japanese legendary creatures]] [[Category:Legendary mammals]] [[Category:Mythological monsters]]
